SPBasePermission.Name: AddAndCustomizePages
SPBasePermission.Description: Add, change, or delete HTML pages or Web Part Pages, and edit the Web site using a Windows SharePoint Services-compatible editor.

SPBasePermission.Name: AddDelPrivateWebParts
SPBasePermission.Description: Add or remove personal Web Parts on a Web Part Page.

SPBasePermission.Name: AddListItems
SPBasePermission.Description: Add items to lists, add documents to document libraries, and add Web discussion comments.

SPBasePermission.Name: ApplyStyleSheets
SPBasePermission.Description: Apply a style sheet (.css file) to the Web site.

SPBasePermission.Name: ApplyThemeAndBorder
SPBasePermission.Description: Apply a theme or borders to the entire Web site.

SPBasePermission.Name: ApproveItems
SPBasePermission.Description: Approve a minor version of a list item or document.

SPBasePermission.Name: BrowseDirectories
SPBasePermission.Description: Enumerate files and folders in a Web site using Microsoft Office SharePoint Designer 2007 and WebDAV interfaces.

SPBasePermission.Name: BrowseUserInfo
SPBasePermission.Description: View information about users of the Web site.

SPBasePermission.Name: CancelCheckout
SPBasePermission.Description: Discard or check in a document which is checked out to another user.

SPBasePermission.Name: CreateAlerts
SPBasePermission.Description: Create e-mail alerts.

SPBasePermission.Name: CreateGroups
SPBasePermission.Description: Create a group of users that can be used anywhere within the site collection.

SPBasePermission.Name: CreateSSCSite
SPBasePermission.Description: Create a Web site using Self-Service Site Creation.

SPBasePermission.Name: DeleteListItems
SPBasePermission.Description: Delete items from a list, documents from a document library, and Web discussion comments in documents.

SPBasePermission.Name: DeleteVersions
SPBasePermission.Description: Delete past versions of a list item or document.

SPBasePermission.Name: EditListItems
SPBasePermission.Description: Edit items in lists, edit documents in document libraries, edit Web discussion comments in documents, and customize Web Part Pages in document libraries.

SPBasePermission.Name: EditMyUserInfo
SPBasePermission.Description: Allows a user to change his or her user information, such as adding a picture.

SPBasePermission.Name: EmptyMask
SPBasePermission.Description: Has no permissions on the Web site. Not available through the user interface.

SPBasePermission.Name: EnumeratePermissions
SPBasePermission.Description: Enumerate permissions on the Web site, list, folder, document, or list item.

SPBasePermission.Name: FullMask
SPBasePermission.Description: Has all permissions on the Web site. Not available through the user interface.

SPBasePermission.Name: ManageAlerts
SPBasePermission.Description: Manage alerts for all users of the Web site.

SPBasePermission.Name: ManageLists
SPBasePermission.Description: Create and delete lists, add or remove columns in a list, and add or remove public views of a list.

SPBasePermission.Name: ManagePermissions
SPBasePermission.Description: Create and change permission levels on the Web site and assign permissions to users and groups.

SPBasePermission.Name: ManagePersonalViews
SPBasePermission.Description: Create, change, and delete personal views of lists.

SPBasePermission.Name: ManageSubwebs
SPBasePermission.Description: Create subsites such as team sites, Meeting Workspace sites, and Document Workspace sites.

SPBasePermission.Name: ManageWeb
SPBasePermission.Description: Grant the ability to perform all administration tasks for the Web site as well as manage content. Activate, deactivate, or edit properties of Web site scoped Features through the object model or through the user interface (UI). When granted on the root Web site of a site collection, activate, deactivate, or edit properties of site collection scoped Features through the object model. To browse to the Site Collection Features page and activate or deactivate site collection scoped Features through the UI, you must be a site collection administrator.

SPBasePermission.Name: Open
SPBasePermission.Description: Allow users to open a Web site, list, or folder to access items inside that container.

SPBasePermission.Name: OpenItems
SPBasePermission.Description: View the source of documents with server-side file handlers.

SPBasePermission.Name: UpdatePersonalWebParts
SPBasePermission.Description: Update Web Parts to display personalized information.

SPBasePermission.Name: UseClientIntegration
SPBasePermission.Description: Use features that launch client applications; otherwise, users must work on documents locally and upload changes.

SPBasePermission.Name: UseRemoteAPIs
SPBasePermission.Description: Use SOAP, WebDAV, or Microsoft Office SharePoint Designer 2007 interfaces to access the Web site.

SPBasePermission.Name: ViewFormPages
SPBasePermission.Description: View forms, views, and application pages, and enumerate lists.

SPBasePermission.Name: ViewListItems
SPBasePermission.Description: View items in lists, documents in document libraries, and view Web discussion comments.

SPBasePermission.Name: ViewPages
SPBasePermission.Description: View pages in a Web site.

SPBasePermission.Name: ViewUsageData
SPBasePermission.Description: View reports on Web site usage.

SPBasePermission.Name: ViewVersions
SPBasePermission.Description: View past versions of a list item or document.

SPItemEventReceiver.Description: The list received a context event.

SPEmailEventReceiver.Description: The list received an e-mail message.

SPItemEventReceiver.Description: An attachment was added to the item.
An attachment is being added to the item.
An attachment was removed from the item.
An attachment is being removed from the item.
An item is being checked in.
An item is being checked out.
An item is being unchecked out.

SPWebEventReceiver.Description: A site collection is being deleted.
Occurs before a new web is created.

DelegateControlId.Description: This will be available inside the head tag and helpful to load the custom css / javascript
SharePoint uses this one to publish the variations menu. Please carefully override this delegate control if needed
To enable Farm level global links and not specific for web application or site collection level
To enable Farm level global links and not specific for web application or site collection level
While editing the page, Server Ribbon will be loaded using this Delegate Control and we extend this using Custom Action
This delegate control will be using to override Search box
To load the custom quick launch data source
To load the custom topnavigation data source

StandardTheme.Description: The default theme has a white background with blue control areas and orange highlights.
Classic has a white background with blue control areas and orange highlights.
Simple has a white background with minimal blue highlights.
Belltown has a light teal motif.
Breeze has a gray frame with teal control areas and orange highlights.
Cardinal has a gray background with red control areas.
Citrus has a green background with yellow control areas and orange highlights.
Granite has a slight brown frame with tan control areas and blue highlights.
Jet has a gray frame with blue control areas and yellow highlights.
Lacquer has a gray background with gray control areas and orange highlights.
Lichen has a khaki frame with olive control areas and orange highlights.
Obsidian has a dark gray frame with light gray control areas and orange highlights.
Petal has a light gray frame with pink control areas and highlights.
Plastic has an orange background with blue control areas.
Reflector has a black background with purple control areas and brown highlights.
Verdant has a complete green motif.
Vintage has a worn tan motif.
Wheat has a golden background with brown control areas.

RibbonListViewLocation.Description: Customization appears when the list view Web Part is present.
Customization appears on the edit form.
Customization appears on the new form.
Customization appears on the display form.
